intro: Lepidocupania, commonly known as the silverleaf plant, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive silver-gray foliage, which is covered in fine, waxy hairs. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in cyathia, a unique floral structure typical of the spurge family. Lepidocupania is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Its leaves are used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties.
